mechanism: Binds opioid receptors for pain relief.
contraindications: Respiratory depression

mechanism: Inhibits sodium and water reabsorption in the kidneys.
contraindications: Hypovolemia
Anuria

mechanism: Lowers blood glucose by facilitating cellular uptake of glucose.
contraindications: Hypoglycemia

mechanism: Enhances the inhibitory effects of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) in the central nervous system.
contraindications: angle-closure glaucome, pregnancy, sleep apnea and/ord respiratory depression
pediatricDose: PO: 1-2.5 mg 3-5x/day; IV/IM 0.25 mg/kg/dose q15-30 min

mechanism: Exact antianxiety mechanism is unknown. Binds to serotonin and dopamine receptors
indications: Panic disorder, OCD, social anxiety disorders, PTSD
contraindications: Concurrent use with MAOI antidepressants

mechanism: Selectively inhibits serotonin reuptake, allowing more serotonin to stay at the junction of the neurons
indications: GAD, panic disorder, OCD, social anxiety disorder, PTSD, depressive disorders
contraindications: Pregnancy, concurrent use with MAOIs or a TCA
